questions.explanation:
7. How was the security audit today?
(A) I can secure them. → Incorrect (unrelated to audit outcome)
(B) Very productive. → Correct (describes the audit's outcome)
(C) If you like. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

8. What dinner specials do you have today?
(A) We have baked salmon. → Correct (specifies the dinner special)
(B) For the first time. → Incorrect (unrelated to dinner specials)
(C) No, I haven't. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

9. When will the order be delivered?
(A) Not until Wednesday afternoon. → Correct (specifies delivery time)
(B) It's time to put them away. → Incorrect (unrelated to delivery time)
(C) The light is on in the mail room. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

10. What's the monthly membership fee for that service?
(A) Twenty euros. → Correct (specifies the fee)
(B) Next month. → Incorrect (refers to time, not cost)
(C) Don't let me forget. → Incorrect (unrelated to the fee)

11. Did you receive the e-mail I sent?
(A) I need a receipt for that. → Incorrect (misinterprets 'receive')
(B) Call a delivery service. → Incorrect (unrelated to e-mail)
(C) I haven't looked at my computer today. → Correct (implies not receiving the e-mail)

12. Why don't you have the meeting this afternoon?
(A) Just past the library and across the street. → Incorrect (refers to location, not reason)
(B) Otherwise, I think it's fine. → Incorrect (vague and unrelated)
(C) Because we have a lot to do today. → Correct (explains the reason)

13. Where did you post the schedule?
(A) I hung a copy on the conference room door. → Correct (specifies the schedule's location)
(B) In a few hours. → Incorrect (refers to time, not location)
(C) Are you sure you submitted it? → Incorrect (unrelated to posting)

14. Who is leading the safety seminar?
(A) That's what he'said. → Incorrect (vague and unrelated)
(B) Elizabeth will do it. → Correct (identifies the seminar leader)
(C) Whenever management prefers. → Incorrect (refers to time, not person)

15. Could you please fill out your time sheet by 3 P.M. today?
(A) How much time do you have? → Incorrect (unrelated to the request)
(B) OK, I'll make a note to do that. → Correct (agrees to fill out the time sheet)
(C) I will place the order as soon as possible. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the request)

16. When is the electrician supposed to get here?
(A) The package got here last night. → Incorrect (unrelated to electrician)
(B) I didn't drive to work today. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) She just let me know she's running late. → Correct (addresses arrival time)

17. I'd like to schedule your performance review meeting.
(A) That is a high-performing team. → Incorrect (unrelated to scheduling)
(B) The food here is very good. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) OK, let me look at my calendar. → Correct (responds to scheduling request)

18. Haven't you been trained to use this machine?
(A) I can get them to take a look. → Incorrect (unrelated to training)
(B) We need to finish before noon. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) I use it all the time. → Correct (implies training was received)

19. Did you bring your computer home or leave it at work?
(A) Yes, last week. → Incorrect (unrelated to the computer’s location)
(B) I left it at the office. → Correct (specifies the computer’s location)
(C) In ten minutes. → Incorrect (refers to time, not location)

20. Why don’t we create a video tour of the convention space?
(A) I lost it yesterday. → Incorrect (unrelated to the video tour)
(B) That film has been very popular. → Incorrect (refers to another film)
(C) I thought you already did that. → Correct (assumes completion, this answer)

21. Isn’t the food usually served at this time?
(A) There’s been a schedule change. → Correct (explains why food isn’t served)
(B) The reviews of that product have been negative. → Incorrect (unrelated to food service)
(C) I’ll go tomorrow instead. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

22. Do you take the bus or train to work?
(A) I love to travel. → Incorrect (unrelated to commute method)
(B) I prefer to drive. → Correct (specifies an alternative commute method)
(C) I only work on Tuesdays. → Incorrect (refers to schedule, not transport)

23. Would you like me to make the reservation for you?
(A) The hotel has a fitness club. → Incorrect (unrelated to the reservation offer)
(B) No, I haven’t heard of it. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the offer)
(C) Sure, let me find the form. → Correct (accepts the reservation offer)

24. Why are you cleaning the laboratory?
(A) Just stack the books against the wall. → Incorrect (unrelated to cleaning reason)
(B) I will attend if I have to. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Haven’t you seen the inspection report? → Correct (implies cleaning due to inspection)

25. What do you think of the highlighted paragraphs in this document?
(A) I think they need further revisions. → Correct (provides opinion on the paragraphs)
(B) There’s some storage space upstairs. → Incorrect (unrelated to the document)
(C) This room has very good lighting. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

26. Who’s going to receive the final delivery?
(A) When everyone leaves the office. → Incorrect (refers to time, not person)
(B) I can wait for it. → Correct (identifies the person receiving the delivery)
(C) Yes, but only on Fridays. → Incorrect (unrelated to the question)

27. I could book our flights now, right?
(A) It’s a long flight. → Incorrect (unrelated to booking permission)
(B) The trade show hasn’t been confirmed. → Correct (implies delay)
(C) It’s in the other room. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

28. Why do we have to reschedule this event?
(A) This weekend or maybe early next week. → Incorrect (refers to time, not reason)
(B) I will do it as soon as possible. → Incorrect (unrelated to reason)
(C) My doctor’s appointment couldn’t be moved. → Correct (explains the rescheduling reason)

29. We should really consider expanding our storefront.
(A) Didn’t you see the contract for the work? → Correct (this answer)
(B) I don’t know how far it is. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) We could borrow one for you. → Incorrect (unrelated to storefront expansion)

30. Do you know whose jacket that is in the conference room?
(A) Sure, if they’re already planning to go. → Incorrect (unrelated to the jacket)
(B) A few people have blue ones like that. → Correct (addresses the jacket’s ownership)
(C) Yes, Janelle usually orders them for us. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

31. When do you usually exercise?
(A) Fitness is important for everyone. → Incorrect (unrelated to timing)
(B) An affordable machine. → Incorrect (refers to equipment, not time)
(C) My doctor has suggested that I stop for a while. → Correct (implies no current exercise schedule)
